Next month, the statue of Amelia Earhart will join President Dwight D. Eisenhower as bronze beacons representing Kansas in our nation’s capital. Her statue will be part of the National Statuary Hall Collection which consists of 100 statues – two contributed by each state.

A bold and inspiring aviator, Amelia Earhart soared into the history books, setting flight records and breaking barriers. Amelia led the way for thousands of women to pursue their dreams – whether that was in aviation or to break their own, new barriers.

BREAKING: The statue of Amelia Earhart will officially be placed in the United States Capitol. The Congressional Statue Dedication Ceremony will take place in the Capitol on July 27. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FWSFJFNWIAQWpNa.jpg
